experience.title: Software Engineer II
experience.summary: Maintained WinForms and web apps for insurance products while standing up .NET Core services with Hangfire/EF over PostgreSQL and SQL Server to support auto-protect features.
description: Developed and maintained .Net WinForms and web applications supporting insurance and tenant operations.
Built .NET Core services with Hangfire and Entity Framework over PostgreSQL and SQL Server to drive insurance auto-protect workflows.
Added background jobs and APIs to keep coverage, eligibility, and billing data in sync across desktop and web products.
Clarified service boundaries and domain concepts, feeding the team’s early domain-driven design adoption.
Established unit-testing patterns for WinForms and service code and paired with engineers to spread the practice.
Collaborated with product and support to triage production issues in legacy code and refactor risky areas for stability.
Documented patterns and deployment steps so newer engineers could safely contribute to the legacy-heavy stack.

experience.title: Lead Developer / Azure DevOps
experience.summary: Led GLP-compliant lab platform across WebForms/MVC/WebAPI, WinForms, and Xamarin with Oracle-backed services, configurable reporting, and Azure DevOps delivery.
description: Led delivery of GLP-compliant lab software with dynamic user-defined data models and custom reporting that preserved traceability and audit trails.
Designed and built ASP.NET WebForms/MVC/WebAPI services with RESTful OData and SOAP endpoints backed by Oracle using nHibernate, Entity Framework, and PL/SQL.
Implemented configurable reporting pipelines so customers could extend data models and generate compliant reports without vendor changes.
Built responsive web interfaces with CSS3, Flexbox, Bootstrap, and AngularJS for desktop and tablet users.
Maintained WinForms clients and Xamarin Forms mobile apps that worked offline and synchronized when connectivity returned.
Guided release engineering and Azure DevOps practices for builds, deployments, and database migrations across environments.
Mentored developers through code reviews and pairing to raise quality on a mixed WebForms/MVC/WebAPI stack.
Worked directly with customers and QA on GLP expectations, ensuring versioning, audit logging, and data lineage were respected in every feature.

experience.title: Programmer/Analyst
experience.summary: Led a VB6 to WinForms modernization of 8+ accounting and inventory modules, automating conversions, unifying security, and delivering early with Agile milestones.
description: Led a team of 6 developers and 3 QA to modernize VB6 accounting and inventory systems into a single WinForms .NET application with role-based security.
Analyzed legacy VB6 patterns and built transformation modules to automate conversion to VB.NET while preserving business logic.
Consolidated 8+ standalone modules (receivables, payables, inventory, equipment, etc.) into one cohesive desktop experience.
Built a new reporting frontend that supported legacy dot-matrix outputs while adding PDF generation and viewing.
Implemented a custom bug reporting and ticketing system so end users could file issues across DEV/UAT/PROD and auto-promote tickets into JIRA via APIs.
Ran Agile roadmaps and milestones, coordinating stakeholders and demos to deliver the modernization roughly three months early.
Drove quality practices and regression coverage so the VB6-to-.NET cutover could ship without breaking daily operations.

experience.title: Senior Software Developer
experience.summary: Consulting across Microsoft-stack projects, mentoring teams while delivering WinForms, ASP.NET, and SQL Server work for multiple clients.
description: Delivered Microsoft-stack projects for multiple clients, moving between WinForms, ASP.NET, and SQL Server work as engagements required.
Mentored junior and mid-level developers on coding standards, testing habits, and practical estimation.
Planned and tracked sprints, risks, and milestones while keeping stakeholders aligned across simultaneous projects.
Conducted code reviews and production readiness checks to keep releases predictable for consulting clients.
Interviewed and recruited engineers, helping shape hiring rubrics and onboarding practices.
Acted as a hands-on contributor when teams needed extra capacity on backend or desktop features.

experience.title: Application Developer/Architect
experience.summary: Built and tuned RETS client/server and configurable ASP.NET MLS sites on Oracle/C#, delivering high-speed compliance and analytics for real estate boards.
description: Developed and maintained RETS client and server software on Oracle and C#, praised as one of the fastest servers in the continental US and first to achieve compliance multiple times.
Tuned RETS performance, protocol compliance, and data handling to keep broker and MLS integrations reliable.
Built configurable ASP.NET MLS frontends where branding and business rules were driven by XML so each board could ship its own experience without code changes.
Created a market analytics and statistics module surfacing deep MLS metrics for brokers and administrators.
Coordinated deployments and maintenance windows with MLS stakeholders to keep uptime and data freshness high.
Provided ongoing support and troubleshooting for MLS customers while evolving the platform’s architecture.

experience.title: Programmer/Analyst
experience.summary: Consulting across law enforcement, logistics, and agribusiness, building C#/ASP.NET/ActionScript solutions with SQL Server backends.
description: Built a C# mobile application for a Sheriff's department to capture and sync field data.
Delivered full-stack .NET and SQL Server development for Zen-Noh Grain, supporting inventory and operations workflows.
Created an ActionScript + ASP.NET tracking application for shipments and tug boats with a custom web backend.
Designed database schemas and service endpoints to keep data consistent across the web and mobile surfaces.
Worked directly with clients to prioritize features and ship iterations quickly as a consultant.

experience.title: Web Developer/Consultant (PK Promotions)
experience.summary: Delivered small-business web apps for commodity production, product evolution tracking, and sales/marketing flows.
description: Built a web-based commodity production management system so the business could track orders and production status in one place.
Implemented product evolution tracking to capture change history and releases for SKUs.
Created sales and marketing tools to support campaigns and basic CRM-style tracking.
Delivered the apps with ASP and database-backed forms while tailoring flows to a small team’s processes.
Worked closely with the owner to refine requirements and roll out incremental improvements.

experience.title: Design Consultant
experience.summary: Outside consultant for a marketing agency, delivering VB6/VB.NET/ASP solutions with Access/SQL Server backends for internal and client-facing tools.
description: Served as an outside consultant augmenting the agency’s development staff on marketing and internal systems.
Built components and frontends in VB6, VB.NET, ASP Classic, and ASP.NET Web Forms with Access and SQL Server backends.
Delivered reporting and data-entry tools tailored to client campaigns and internal operations.
Coordinated with in-house developers and designers to align functionality with branding and timelines.
Assisted in IT system design decisions so new work fit within existing infrastructure.

experience.title: Programmer/Analyst I
experience.summary: Built desktop and web tools in a banking environment using Access/DB2/Argo Data, ASP, validation JavaScript, and SQL Server.
description: Developed desktop applications that pulled from Access and DB2/Argo Data sources for banking teams.
Implemented reporting and data-access front-ends to surface financial data accurately.
Built data-driven ASP pages with validation JavaScript for internal web workflows.
Designed and implemented SQL Server applications to support the web and desktop tools.
Worked within regulated banking processes to keep data handling reliable and auditable.

experience.title: Engineering Application Developer
experience.summary: Early career building 3D-to-2D transformation tooling for shipbuilding drawings, deployments, logging, and a scripting IDE for engineers.
description: Wrote 3D-to-2D code transformations for shipbuilding engineering drawings on the LPD-17 project.
Managed deployment of networked applications used by engineering teams.
Developed error reporting/logging databases and front-ends to monitor transformation runs.
Built an IDE to script and automate the transforms so engineers could iterate without rewriting code.
Collaborated with engineers to translate CAD/geometry requirements into reliable transformation routines.

experience.title: Technician/Programmer
experience.summary: Hands-on technician work repairing PCs, troubleshooting Windows, and building small custom apps for local businesses.
description: Troubleshot and resolved software issues for local customers on Windows 3.1 through Windows 2000.
Repaired and built IBM-compatible PCs, installing and configuring operating systems and peripherals.
Created small custom applications for small businesses to automate routine tasks.
Handled on-site support, translating user needs into practical fixes and documenting steps for non-technical staff.

skills.name: Agile Methodologies
skills.description: A set of iterative and incremental software development approaches that emphasize adaptability, flexibility, and continuous improvement. Agile methodologies break down large projects into smaller, manageable units called sprints. This allows for faster feedback loops, quicker delivery of features, and better adaptation to changing requirements.

skills.name: AngularJS
skills.description: A popular JavaScript framework for building dynamic web applications. AngularJS uses a declarative programming style and offers features like two-way data binding and dependency injection.

skills.name: Azure DevOps
skills.description: A cloud-based DevOps platform that provides tools for planning, building, testing, and deploying software applications. Azure DevOps integrates with Microsoft Azure and other cloud platforms.

skills.name: Bootstrap
skills.description: A popular front-end framework that provides a collection of CSS styles and JavaScript components for building responsive and mobile-friendly websites. Bootstrap can help developers create consistent and visually appealing user interfaces.

skills.name: C#
skills.description: A general-purpose, object-oriented programming language developed by Microsoft. Widely used for building various types of software applications, including web applications, desktop applications, mobile applications, and games. Known for its strong typing, garbage collection, and integration with the .NET Framework and .NET Core.

skills.name: Cloud Platforms
skills.description: Platforms that provide on-demand access to computing resources over the internet. Cloud platforms offer various services like infrastructure as a service (IaaS), platform as a service (PaaS), and software as a service (SaaS). Popular cloud platforms include Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, and Google Cloud Platform.

skills.name: Cloud computing (Azure)
skills.description: On-demand delivery of IT resources like servers, storage, databases, networking, software, analytics, and intelligence over the internet. Microsoft Azure is a leading cloud computing platform that offers a wide range of services for building, deploying, and managing applications on a global scale. Cloud computing provides scalability, elasticity, and cost-effectiveness for software development.

skills.name: CSS
skills.description: Cascading Style Sheets used to style web pages.

skills.name: Database Development
skills.description: The process of designing, creating, and managing databases to store and manage application data. SQL Server and Oracle are popular relational database management systems (RDBMS) used for various applications. Database development involves defining database schema, writing queries to retrieve and manipulate data, and ensuring data integrity and security.

skills.name: Full-stack development
skills.description: The ability to develop both the front-end (user interface) and back-end (server-side) components of a web application. Full-stack developers possess skills in various areas like programming languages, frameworks, databases, and APIs. This allows them to work independently on all aspects of a web application.

skills.name: Git
skills.description: A popular version control system used for tracking changes to source code and other files. Git allows developers to collaborate efficiently and manage different versions of their projects.

skills.name: iOS
skills.description: The operating system used on Apple devices like iPhones, iPads, and iPods.

skills.name: JavaScript
skills.description: Versatile, lightweight, interpreted, or just-in-time compiled programming language. It is primarily known as the scripting language for web pages, enabling dynamic and interactive content, but it is also used in various non-browser environments like Node.js for server-side development.

skills.name: JIRA
skills.description: A popular project management and issue tracking tool used by software development teams. JIRA helps teams plan, track, and manage their work, and provides features like Kanban boards, Scrum boards, and agile reporting.

skills.name: Kanban
skills.description: A visual method for managing work that focuses on visualizing the workflow, limiting work in progress, and continuously improving the process. Kanban boards are often used to represent the different stages of a project, with cards representing tasks or items. Kanban is often used in combination with Agile methodologies.

skills.name: Leadership
skills.description: The ability to influence, motivate, and inspire others to achieve a common goal. Effective leadership is essential for managing software development teams and driving successful projects.

skills.name: Mentoring
skills.description: The process of guiding and supporting others in their career development. Mentoring can help junior developers learn new skills, grow their careers, and become more successful.

skills.name: Microsoft Azure
skills.description: A leading cloud computing platform from Microsoft that offers a wide range of services for building, deploying, and managing applications on a global scale. Cloud computing provides scalability, elasticity, and cost-effectiveness for software development.

skills.name: Microsoft SQL Server
skills.description: A popular relational database management system (RDBMS) from Microsoft. SQL Server is widely used for enterprise applications and offers a comprehensive set of features for data management.

skills.name: Mobile application development
skills.description: The process of creating software applications for mobile devices like smartphones and tablets. Mobile app development involves using specific programming languages, frameworks, and tools to build apps for platforms like iOS and Android.

skills.name: Oracle
skills.description: A popular relational database management system (RDBMS) used for various applications. Oracle offers a comprehensive set of features for data management, including data warehousing, data mining, and business intelligence.

skills.name: Problem-solving
skills.description: The ability to identify and resolve issues effectively. Problem-solving skills are essential for software development, as developers often encounter challenges and need to find creative solutions.

skills.name: Project management
skills.description: The application of knowledge, skills, tools, and techniques to plan, organize, and implement a project effectively. In software development, project management involves tasks like defining project scope, creating a development plan, allocating resources, tracking progress, and managing risks. Effective project management ensures projects are completed on time, within budget, and meet the desired quality standards.

skills.name: Regular Expressions
skills.description: Powerful text pattern matching tool used for searching, manipulating, and validating text data. Commonly used in software development for tasks like data extraction, validation forms, and parsing complex text formats. Regular expressions provide a concise and efficient way to match specific patterns within strings.

skills.name: Software development
skills.description: The process of creating computer programs and applications. Software development involves various stages, including planning, designing, coding, testing, and deployment.

skills.name: Team Building
skills.description: The process of creating a cohesive and productive team environment.  In software development, effective team building fosters collaboration, communication, and problem-solving among developers, designers, project managers, and other stakeholders. This leads to a more efficient development process and higher quality software.

skills.name: Team management
skills.description: The ability to lead and motivate a team of individuals to achieve a common goal. Effective team management involves setting clear expectations, providing guidance and support, and fostering a positive team culture.

skills.name: Time management
skills.description: The ability to effectively manage your time and prioritize tasks. Good time management skills are essential for software developers to meet deadlines and deliver high-quality work.

skills.name: Unified Modeling Language (UML)
skills.description: A standard visual language for software development. UML diagrams provide a way to represent the blueprint of a software system, including its classes, objects, relationships, interactions, and processes. UML helps developers visualize, design, document, and understand complex software systems.

skills.name: Visual Basic .NET
skills.description: Another object-oriented programming language developed by Microsoft specifically for the .NET platform. Offers a visually intuitive syntax similar to Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) used in Microsoft Office products. Popular for rapid application development (RAD) and building Windows applications.

skills.name: Web development
skills.description: The process of creating websites and web applications. Web developers use various technologies like: HTML, CSS, JavaScript and TypeScript.

skills.name: .NET Core
skills.description: Building backend services and libraries on the modern .NET runtime with C#.

skills.name: Entity Framework
skills.description: Object-relational mapper for .NET used to model data, manage migrations, and query SQL databases.

skills.name: ASP.NET
skills.description: Web application framework covering Web Forms, MVC, and WebAPI for building APIs and web apps on .NET.

skills.name: WinForms
skills.description: Windows desktop application framework used for line-of-business client development.

skills.name: PostgreSQL
skills.description: Open-source relational database used for transactional workloads and services.

skills.name: Hangfire
skills.description: .NET background job scheduler for queues, delayed tasks, and recurring workloads.

skills.name: Xamarin Forms
skills.description: Cross-platform .NET UI framework for building mobile apps sharing a single codebase.

skills.name: OData/SOAP APIs
skills.description: Designing and consuming service endpoints using OData and SOAP protocols for enterprise integrations.

skills.name: Legacy modernization
skills.description: Refactoring and incrementally improving long-lived systems to be testable, maintainable, and easier to ship.

Kept WinForms and web applications moving by tightening unit test coverage and contributing to early domain-driven design efforts.

Introduced unit testing patterns to WinForms and kept desktop and service layers in sync during domain-driven design adoption.

description: Led a team modernizing VB6 accounting and inventory software, replacing legacy reporting and PDF generation.

Supported sales and marketing systems for the business.

Delivered production management, product tracking, and sales/marketing systems for a small shop.
Built front-ends in VB6/VB.NET/ASP with Access, InterDev, Flash, and SQL Server; helped design IT systems for clients.
Built desktop apps on DB2/Argo Data with reporting UIs, data-driven ASP pages, and validation JavaScript.
Designed SQL Server applications to support the workflows.
Wrote 3D-to-2D transforms, deployed network applications, and built error logging/reporting on the LPD-17 project.
Built an IDE so those transforms could be scripted instead of rewritten.
Fixed and built PCs, troubleshot software, and wrote custom tools for small businesses.

master.label: Master About (Neutral)
paragraphs: Systems-first developer with a long arc in .NET and JavaScript, comfortable moving between desktop, web, and backend work to make long-lived products easier to change.
Focus areas include refactoring legacy code, tightening data flows, and shipping dependable features with clear UX and sensible engineering practices.

about-code-monkey.label: Code Monkey About
paragraphs: Most of my career has been spent inside complex systems: long-lived .NET codebases, awkward architectures, and business processes that grew faster than anyone designed them. The more tangled the problem, the clearer the map becomes.

I take responsibility for hard systems other people depend on, learn how they really work, and make them easier to change. That has meant living deep in C#, .NET Core, WinForms, ASP.NET, SQL Server, and PostgreSQL—untangling apps and nudging teams toward testable, maintainable designs.
Systems are not neutral; they decide who carries risk and who fights fires. I prefer building things that reduce hidden load and failure modes instead of chasing whatever is trending.
Outside of work it is quieter - cooking, biking, games, and reading - but the same habit shows up: notice patterns, refine systems, and leave them better than I found them.

about-backend-modernization.label: Backend / Modernization About
paragraphs: Senior .NET engineer focused on backend services, data flows, and modernization. Comfortable moving legacy workloads toward testable .NET Core/C# services, tightening telemetry, and improving reliability around schedulers, queues, and APIs.
Works close to the database layer (SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Oracle) and cares about shipping incremental improvements without breaking the business.

about-desktop-winforms.label: Desktop / WinForms About
paragraphs: Thick-client specialist with deep experience in WinForms and desktop line-of-business apps. Modernizes legacy UI flows, introduces sustainable testing patterns, and connects desktop clients to dependable services.
Comfortable straddling older tech (VB6/WinForms/Web Forms) and newer patterns to keep critical desktop products alive while improving maintainability.

about-fullstack-dotnet.label: Fullstack .NET About
paragraphs: Fullstack .NET developer who owns the path from UI through APIs to data. Builds and maintains ASP.NET Web Forms/MVC/WebAPI services, styles responsive interfaces, and keeps data models coherent.
Habitually improves developer experience and testability so fullstack changes can ship without fear. Comfortable across C#, JavaScript/TypeScript, AngularJS, Bootstrap, SQL Server, and PostgreSQL.

about-solution-architect.label: Solution Architect About
paragraphs: Solution-focused architect who designs pragmatic modernization paths for long-lived .NET systems. Balances legacy constraints with improved patterns, data contracts, and team practices.
Mentors teams on testing, service boundaries, and delivery so products become easier to evolve instead of harder to maintain.

items.name: Cognition
items.description: A .NET-based agentic orchestration system that wraps LLMs with tools, background workers, and structured pipelines for planning and execution. Focuses on durable workflows, message/state tracking, and clear separation between model calls and application logic.

items.name: Resume & Profile Site
items.description: A GitHub Pages site that renders multi-profile resume views from structured JSON data, including a default 'Code Monkey' profile and employer-focused variants for backend, desktop, fullstack, and architect roles.

items.name: Dominus
items.description: A DOM utility library that builds Bootstrap 5 and Bootswatch interfaces from code, aiming to reduce raw HTML boilerplate and make UI construction more declarative and composable.

items.name: Random Dialog Engine
items.description: A lightweight dialog engine for games and narrative systems that models conversations and internal monologue using reusable dialog primitives and simple stateful flows.

items.name: Maze-Battle & Maze-Quest
items.description: A pair of JavaScript experiments combining maze traversal with RPG-style encounters: Maze-Quest focuses on Minecraft-inspired maze exploration, while Maze-Battle extends the idea with combat and encounter logic.

items.name: Fractal & Geometry Experiments
items.description: A series of visual experiments centered on cube-based generative structures (cubix-gen) alongside Cantor sets and binary tree fractals, exploring recursion, geometry, and visual pattern generation in HTML/JavaScript.

items.name: SQL Server Information Schema Tools
items.description: A C# utility library for querying and shaping SQL Server information schema metadata, designed to support reporting, refactors, and schema-aware tooling.

items.name: English Lexicon & NLP Data Experiments
items.description: Fork-based experiments around large English word datasets and CEFR-level annotations, exploring ways to combine frequency, part-of-speech, and difficulty metadata for NLP and language-learning tools.
